intro: Seseli salsugineum, commonly known as the rock salsugineum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, clustered fruits. Seseli salsugineum is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
